resources.text: This is a patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes. The patient is currently on medication and has regular check-ups scheduled every 3 months.
Observation: Blood pressure reading is 140/90 mmHg. This is slightly elevated and the patient has been advised to monitor their blood pressure regularly and follow a low-sodium diet.
Encounter: The patient visited the clinic for a routine check-up. Vital signs were stable, and no new symptoms were reported. Follow-up in 6 months.
MedicationRequest: Prescribed metformin 500 mg, to be taken twice daily with meals for management of type 2 diabetes.

Condition: The patient has been diagnosed with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). They are advised to avoid smoking and exposure to pollutants, and to engage in pulmonary rehabilitation exercises.
